http://www.london2012.com/visiting/getting-to-the-games/locations-of-venues/index.php

Handball Arena to Copper Box

Hockey Centre to Riverbank Arena

Michael

Locog are renaming a couple of the venues:
hockey centre -> riverbank arena
handball arena -> copper box

This is producing some issues. See #6841.

It also looks like some of the dependency tracking is broken. i.e. some of the following pages with embedded links to the hockey centre are not being updated:

./news/2011/07/london-2012-celebrates-one-year-to-go.php
./news/2011/03/blue-hockey-pitches-to-make-their-olympic-debut-at-londo.php
./news/2011/10/london-2012-hockey-centre-pitch-unveiled.php
./fr/games/venues/riverbank-arena.php
./mobile/news/2011/07/london-2012-celebrates-one-year-to-go.php
./mobile/news/2011/03/blue-hockey-pitches-to-make-their-olympic-debut-at-londo.php

Cheers, Andy From: Jon George [mailto:jon@earthware.co.uk] Sent: 11 January 2012 11:44 To: Andy Watkins Subject: RE: OTR map update Hi Andy, I think I’ve tracked down the problem – turns out I was looking in the wrong place. As part of the refactoring we have changed the name of the element that needs to be on the target page – it was originally called mapcontainer, we’ve now got a parent element called torchmapcontainer as we wanted to differentiate between the different maps we’re using. I expect Kitsite will need to make this change. Find the element in the page that looks like this:
And replace it with this:
And we should be good to go. Sorry about the delay getting this sorted. Cheers Jon

PROTECT Hi Danny We need change some text in a tool tip on this application form- link below. Apart from other things it refers to the ODA as the Olympic Delivery Agency! http://www.london2012.com/making-it-happen/advertising-and-trading-regul ations/applicationform.php?licence=1&EventZoneID= The tool tip we need to change is; Three full-face passport-size photographs. See screen grab. (The text on the form below is fine on the same tool tip but Olympic Delivery Agency need to be changed to Olympic Delivery Authority) http://www.london2012.com/making-it-happen/advertising-and-trading-regul ations/applicationform.php?licence=0&EventZoneID= Text If applying as an individual you must provide three full-face passport-size photographs of the applicant taken within the last 12 months one of which must be countersigned by the issuer of your current licence/permit/agreement to confirm ID and provide designation and contact details. Photographs will not be accepted if the face is obscured by sunglasses. The wearing of head covering should be avoided unless on religious grounds. We require these photographs to generate an authorisation document which will be destroyed if your application is unsuccessful. Hi,

With two venue names changing today, I've been doing some updates on the website and have come across an issue that has me stumped!

On each sport page, the venue info is displayed in a box on the right hand side of the screen, like this...

[cid:image001.png@01CCCEF0.263EE230]



However, now the Handball Arena and ther Hockey Centre venues (and pages) have been updated to the Copper Box and Riverbank Arena respectively, the venue box is no longer appearing on the relevant sport pages.

I've tried adding the old venue name AND the new venue name to the "Venue" field in the CMS metadata, but neither of these did the trick. Tom Price-Stephens suggested this info was hardcoded and that it was something I had to ask you.

Copper Box should be appearing on the Handball, Goalball and Modern Pentathlon pages.

Riverbank Arena should be appearing on the Hockey, 5-a-side Football and 7-a-side Football pages.

Please can someone look at this?

Thanks very much,

Michael

Michael Thorne
Content Coordinator
Editorial Services department

One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Fax: +44 (0)20 7719 1308

Hi Michael,

You need to add just the new venue name to the Sports page ie. "Copper box"
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/handball.php
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/hockey.php

The name also has to *exactly* match the name of the venue page in the meta data.

I hav updated (but not published the above two pages) I haven't yet updated the other pages.

One last thing to note is that all other pages (videos, photos, news etc.) will have the old venue names and the taxonomy still has the old venue names./

I assume you want us to:

i) update the taxonomy 
ii) update the venue name on every page that uses it as a venue tag (and republish those pages) *

* unfortunately renaming a tag doesn't cause all instances/references to it of it to get renamed as (for performance reasons) we actually store the name/venue on the page/on the metadata rather than a reference or ID that refers to a tag. The upshot is that all the pages on the site are still tagged to the old venue names.

Jamie

Hi,

I’m looking to bring the webcams on the French website in line with those on the English and wondered if you could please advise.

As far as I can see some of those on the English site – eg the inside of the Basketball Arena – are not present for the French site in CMS

Is there an easy way of aligning the webcams across the two sites?

http://www.london2012.com/fr/webcams/eton-manor.php - this page also needs to be renamed. It’s currently titled Webcam 3 du stade olympique and needs to be changed to Eton Manor

Thanks

From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com]
Sent: 16 December 2011 09:38
To: Michael Thorne
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: New webcam page

Hi Michael, it seems that these ( underneath ) pages have the "hide-from-navigation" meta-data checkbox ticked and so aren't displayed on the french site. You can just edit them in the cms and remove the tick to show them, they should automatically appear on the webcam hub. This should also show the basket ball arena ( salle-de-basket ) 

-- Hidden pages:
fr/webcams/webcam-2-du-stade-olympique.php
fr/webcams/centre-de-presse-principal.php
fr/webcams/centre-international-de-radio-et-television.php
fr/webcams/centre-energetique.php
fr/webcams/gros-plan-sur-le-centre-nautique.php
fr/webcams/salle-de-handball.php
fr/webcams/village-olympique-regardant-au-nord.php
fr/webcams/village-olympique-regardant-a-l-est.php
fr/webcams/velodrome.php
fr/webcams/centre-nautique.php
fr/webcams/village-olympique.php
fr/webcams/salle-de-basket.php

I've renamed the page to Eton Manor and republished it.

Hi Lars,

Thanks for getting back to me.

The French Basketball Arena webcam – salle-de-basket – is not the same image as the one on the English website. The French on is an external shot, while the English one shows the inside of the arena. Do you know how we can get the same webcam on both?

Additionally, this one – fr/webcams/village-olympique.php – seems to be quite out of date compared to the same webcam on the English website. Is this something you could look at?

Thanks
Hi Michael, i've fixed both of them and they are publishing!
Thanks!

comments.value: Tom, I think we are still waiting to hear from TwoFour on the HTML5 implementation of their player.
Do you need anything from me?

From: Amy Prosser [mailto:Amy.Prosser@twofour.co.uk] 

We sent some instructions over earlier for implementing the HTML5 fallback into the LOCOG player but it looks like the email content has been blocked by our message labs systems.
 
I have therefore uploaded the body of the email and the relevant .zip attachment to our FTP server in hope that you can access it this way.
 
Please could you let me know if you receive this email and can download the links ok?
 
http://download.twofourdigital.net/events/LOCOG/locog-sample.zip
 
http://download.twofourdigital.net/events/LOCOG/LOCOG_HTML5_Fallback_Instructions.docx
 
Kind regards
 
Amy

Have implemented the HTML5  iFrame fallback
http://www.london2012.com/videos/2012/winter-update-2012.php

We still need to republish all the videos, but be good to get the above signed off before we do that.

Also did you start generating 700px wide videos, the current ones look a bit odd floating in the middle of the Video page template. Ideally all videos would be available in that size (or better still both sizes) but I know that's not possible for legacy videos. Would be interesting to know if we could get TwoFour to somehow supply the wider video if it was available (possible by passing a height/width attribute to http://players.mediafreedom.twofourdigital.net/locog/script/config.js). Maybe we could setup a call re. this?

Jamie

subscription data from the Kitsite CMS, and thus the removal of this
large accountable personal data store, now that we are using the
eDialog CRM to manage user subscriptions to the london2012.comwebsite.

assurance activities around the webhosting management?

Aaron

Before we do this, I think it's sensible for me to check whether you are 100% certain that all of the data you require has been exported from the Kitsite UMS. I ask this because what you're asking us to do is clearly a one-way process; i.e. once it's deleted, it's deleted - including from backups.

Kieran
